# Brits warned Victorian disease leaving young people 'unable to walk' - key details

## There was a recent outbreak at an Amazon warehouse in Coventry

09:58, 31 Jan 2026

![Brits warned Victorian disease leaving young people 'unable to walk'](https://i2-prod.birminghammail.co.uk/article33337851.ece/ALTERNATES/s1200e/0_Man-was-suffering-from-painful-chest-pain-from-a-chronic-disease.jpg)

Brits warned Victorian disease leaving young people 'unable to walk'(Image: Getty Images)

**A leading medical professor has warned that England is on the verge of losing its status as a "low-incidence" tuberculosis (TB) nation. Cases rose by 13% in 2024 and continued to climb through the first three quarters of 2025.**

- Professor Onn Min Kon stated that "productive young people in the prime of their lives" are being severely affected by the disease. Some patients have been left unable to walk or paralyzed due to advanced infections.

- While most TB affects the lungs, "extra-pulmonary" TB can attack the spine with devastating, life-changing consequences. Although spinal TB accounts for less than 10% of cases, the financial and rehabilitation implications are profound.

- The warning follows a recent outbreak at an Amazon warehouse in Coventry, where 10 employees tested positive for the condition. This incident led to calls from union bosses for the facility to be temporarily closed for safety.

- Experts suggest the increased severity of recent cases may be a "carryover" from the pandemic period. Many people initially attributed their chronic coughs to COVID-19, allowing infectious TB to reach much more advanced stages.
